comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: This image has been used in the indicommons.org post Interview: Helena Zinkham, Prints & Photographs Division, Library of Congress, with the hope that someone will, some day, recognize these men.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: If you turn the date in mirror view, you'll find that the first digit is a 7 with the short arm turned to the right which makes it a 5 without the lower inverted "C". Most of the pictures of the series LC-B2-2198-x are date-scratched 5/16/11 and most of them were likely taken after Ciudad Juarez fell in insurrectos (Maderistas) hands, on May 10, 1911. The escene seems to be an American doctor attending a wounded insurrecto (See in this Bain Collection photo "Americans With Madero" "Dr. Wilson chief of our hospital corps" There's a picture in the Scott Photo Collection (Nr. 19) in which are depicted an armed man (maybe an insurrecto) and a wounded man, that seem were photographed on the same brick wall, which can be also found in your digital collections and programs: hdl.loc.gov./loc.pnp/cph.3b39285 which seems to be precedent of picture hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp´/cph3b39286 "A fallen hero" where it seems to be the corner of the same brick wall (both dated c 1911). Dr. Roberto Duarte Plastic Reconstructive Surgeon
